intro: Hieracium subtruncatum, commonly known as the blunt-lobed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by several ray florets, and it produces small, oblong achenes as its fruit. Hieracium subtruncatum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
